column1: Oklahoma is currently witnessing an alarming winter coronavirus surge as infections and hospitalizations continue to climb.  Science shows that we can reduce the spread and save lives with temporary interventions.  Read my op-ed in @TheOklahoman_ ↓ https://t.co/BzdmlMo0eb

THANK YOU to all of Oklahoma's COVID-19 frontline workers & rural health care providers as they work to keep our communities safe on #NationalRuralHealthDay!  In Congress I’ll always support initiatives that expand & protect health care access for rural communities across #OK03.

Throughout the COVID-19 pandemic I've been proud to champion efforts supporting rural health care in Oklahoma.  Early on in the pandemic I urged the Trump Administration to provide assistance to rural health providers using CARES Act funding. https://t.co/NkEFVNtiAP

More promising news in the global fight against COVID-19!   According to early data ⁦@moderna_tx⁩’s COVID-19 vaccine is 94.5% effective. We all share a common goal: to defeat the coronavirus and return to normality. https://t.co/9qs5XEI12W

Once a COVID vaccine is approved by the @US_FDA I encourage all Americans to receive a COVID vaccine.   As a father who vaccinated his children and as a rancher who vaccinates his cattle it's important we follow the direction of our doctors to stop the spread of COVID-19.

HUGE NEWS!  Scientists doctors and researchers around the world have been working at extraordinary speeds to develop a safe effective COVID-19 vaccine. This is truly a historic moment for innovation and a promising step for the health of our Nation. https://t.co/N81kKKlx6C

Thanks to the CARES Act Oklahoma's hospitals & small businesses have been given much needed support during the coronavirus pandemic.   In @GuthrieOK alone more than 1500 jobs were saved thanks to the PPP.  READ MORE via @GuthrieLeader ↓ https://t.co/HSPJSKpMSb

Grateful to be named a Guardian of Small Business by @NFIB!  Small family-owned businesses are the engines to local economies throughout Oklahoma and in the wake of COVID-19 it’s critically important that we support our local business owners to keep our communities thriving. https://t.co/m3Tw7KrEYh

OK-03 is home to many small business owners who have embodied the entrepreneurial spirit & stepped up to fight COVID-19.  Yesterday I visited @PWSpirits to check out how they shifted operations to produce hand sanitizer & to thank them for looking out for our fellow Oklahomans. https://t.co/34SGonOBFm

As COVID-19 spread throughout the U.S. one thing became clear from our public health officials: Americans needed to increase the practice of good hygiene.  Distilleries quickly joined the fight and began making hand sanitizer- including @PWSpirits. https://t.co/FORrgFb4HW.

During the COVID-19 pandemic many of our fellow Oklahomans have fallen on hard times. Thankfully organizations like @WeatherfordFRC have stepped in to help.  Today I visited @WeatherfordFRC to learn about their operations during COVID-19 & to ask how Congress can further help. https://t.co/lxSP9GEbPb

I’m grateful for the care that Oklahoma’s medical providers have given to my fellow Oklahomans.  As we fight the spread of COVID-19 Congress and the Trump Admin. must continue to help our communities increase testing & expand telehealth services for our rural communities. https://t.co/ybj7DNS9fP

Last week I visited @integrishealth- Canadian Valley Hospital to show my appreciation to Oklahoma’s frontline workers.   Throughout the COVID-19 pandemic Oklahoma’s doctors nurses and frontline workers have risen to the occasion caring for their communities and neighbors. https://t.co/5oLhSu5xJ6

Oklahoma's cattle ranchers have been hit hard by COVID-19 & food supply chain disruptions.   I'm proud to join @RepDustyJohnson @HouseAgGOP Ranking Member @ConawayTX11 and others in introducing the PRICE Act- legislation providing solutions to ease the burdens felt by ranchers. https://t.co/BU2m95bSmR

Lynda and I join millions across America in praying for  @POTUS and @FLOTUS and all of those impacted by the coronavirus.  I hope my fellow Oklahomans join me in continuing to follow @CDCgov guidelines of washing your hands wearing a mask and practicing social distancing.

Thanks to #OperationWarpSpeed the U.S. is developing a safe effective vaccine to defeat #COVID19.  An effective vaccine will protect Americans & help businesses reopen fully & safely.  Read more about current recovery efforts in @TheAltusTimes ↓ https://t.co/abWKIrtDcY

Wheat growers are resilient but many still face challenges due the pandemic. COVID-19 has weakened market positions across all commodities throughout the U.S.- especially wheat.   Thank you @SecretarySonny for addressing the needs of Oklahoma's hard red winter wheat growers.

📻 TUNE IN: This morning at 8:00 a.m. CST I'll be on @KRMGtulsa with @rcourikrmg talking COVID-19 relief legislation negotiations election security and my bill- the Rural STEM Education Act.   Listen live ↓ https://t.co/CwxKgStO9f

Even though COVID-19 has disrupted air travel the need to invest in Oklahoma’s rural airports remains.   The Third District’s airports are a valuable component of our infrastructure and an important economic development tool.   Thank you @SecElaineChao! https://t.co/XvFCYmK6IJ

Our Nation's #wheat growers have experienced significant volatility and lower prices due to COVID-19.  Today 25 of my House colleagues & I sent a bipartisan letter urging @USDA to expand CFAP eligibility to include all wheat varieties.  READ THE LETTER ↓ https://t.co/26QmmZ5qD1

Great news for Oklahoma's school kids!  Thank you @USDA for extending school nutrition waivers. The flexibility provided by @USDA will ensure Oklahoma's school children have access to nutritious food as our communities continue to respond to COVID-19. https://t.co/e4d7UnpekV

Just like our communities small businesses rural hospitals are also feeling the economic pressure of COVID-19.  @RepJasonSmith's Saving Rural Hospitals from Closure Act would help keep our rural hospitals open and ensure no one loses access to healthcare. https://t.co/bsRnmvG2h3

Today @CommerceGov awarded $1.2 MILLION in @US_EDA grants to assist communities across Oklahoma's Third District in responding to the coronavirus pandemic and safely begin the economic recovery process.  Thank you @SecretaryRoss for your investment in OK! https://t.co/TZBlN6AHVd

ICYMI: We’ve seen disturbing evidence of state-sponsored cyberattacks from China & Russia directed at America's research on combating COVID-19.  Through the NIST COVID-19 Cybersecurity Act @RepAndyBarr and I are helping to protect our national security and our vital research. https://t.co/fwxW3gxJGn

ICYMI: The COVID-19 pandemic has caused unprecedented disruptions to beef processing which has been devastating to cattle producers.  The RAMP-UP Act addresses these supply chain issues ensuring ranchers and farmers have robust access to new markets. https://t.co/MEIyiVDfeo

The #PaycheckProtectionProgram has saved more than 620000 jobs and kept more than 64000 businesses open in Oklahoma.  Find out how your small business can receive much needed relief during the #coronavirus pandemic ↓ https://t.co/ePqivb2Ltt

Whether you're having trouble paying your bills looking for student loan borrower benefits or looking for resources on how best to manage your finances the @CFPB is committed to protecting consumers during the coronavirus.   FIND YOUR RESOURCE ↓ https://t.co/vCyqhooyqo

Today @FinancialCmte held a hearing with @CFPBDirector on the Bureau's work to protect consumers during the COVID-19 crisis.  While my colleagues across the aisle tried to discredit the Bureau @FinancialCmte Republicans took a look at just how @CFPB is offering help.   WATCH ↓ https://t.co/mbG8bdCtzR

Yesterday I spoke to  @OKCFOX's @DanSnyderFOX25 about the legislative priorities that must be in Congress' next COVID-19 relief package.  It's critical that Congress extend the Paycheck Protection Program and provide funds for @USDA's Commodity Credit Corporation.   🎥: @OKCFOX https://t.co/Cu3qT92Qu6

U.S. adversaries including the Chinese Communist Party and Russia are spreading COVID-19 disinformation & hacking COVID-19 research exploiting our communities across the country.  We mustn't let our adversaries threaten our health or national security. https://t.co/xuW6iFvsEn

Proud to have @JerryMoran & @SenatorLankford introduce the Senate companion to my bill- the RAMP-UP Act.  During COVID-19 Congress can and must help strengthen our nation's food supply chain by helping processors gain the tools necessary to become federally inspected facilities. https://t.co/hP9GgOD2Ue

COVID-19 has shed light on the incredible importance of a strong food supply chain.  I applaud @GovStitt & @OklahomaAg @blaynearthur for providing the critical resources necessary for Oklahomans to help strengthen our nation's food supply chain.  https://t.co/2ZHf1GDVoA

This afternoon @USDA released a report detailing market conditions in the context of the Agency's ongoing beef market investigation- launched after the Holcomb Kansas fire and expanded to include market developments during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/EFMMCrf4Eg

As our nation's vast research enterprise remains committed to our coronavirus response China and Russia's unlawful cyberattacks have only grown more aggressive.  China & Russia's theft continues to threaten our public health and national security.   ↓↓ https://t.co/b8YOKFNabG https://t.co/E8Q8NgRGN5

The Chinese Communist Party and now Russia are threatening to weaken America’s pandemic response by stealing U.S. coronavirus research.  Their theft threatens U.S. scientific research health and national security and must not go unchecked.  https://t.co/zZjZOyqLpv

On Tuesday @OKcommerce launched Phase 2 of the Oklahoma Business Relief Program.  @OKcommerce and the OBRP are working hard to help local businesses across the state overcome the economic challenges of COVID-19.   Learn more ↓ https://t.co/pTRv9egeSN

During #COVID19 families across the U.S. are relying more & more on youth mentorship organizations like @4H.  As a proud alumnus of @Oklahoma4H and advocate for STEM & ag education I know just how big the impact is these organizations have on our youth. https://t.co/mClizu9K57

The coronavirus caused unprecedented market and operational disruptions to Oklahoma's livestock producers.  The RAMP-UP Act helps address America's food supply chain issues while helping our state's processing facilities receive federal inspection status. https://t.co/myKcoQ4zD9

Today I joined @HouseAgDems Chairman Collin Peterson in introducing the RAMP-UP Act.   During the COVID-19 pandemic our meat processing industry has faced unprecedented challenges impacting livestock pork and other producers across the U.S. https://t.co/6V1ISixiNK

China holds an overwhelming advantage in access to critical minerals and the COVID-19 pandemic has made it dangerously clear that we can’t take our supply for granted.   The U.S. must better develop our resources and manage our access to critical minerals. https://t.co/BcJUhcDIGM

We cannot allow American leadership in #STEM to be compromised in the wake of #COVID19.   I'm proud to have introduced the #RISEAct with my friends @RepDianaDeGette @RepEBJ @RepFredUpton @RepAnnaEshoo & @RepAGonzalez to ensure our research enterprise is wholly supported. https://t.co/qWAn5o3rKs

#COVID19 has impacted rural & urban communities alike. During this unprecedented time it's critical the @federalreserve continue its actions supporting our rural economies households & businesses.   Today I discussed how important the Fed's actions are with Chairman Powell ↓ https://t.co/vZgfpD9Upd

Oklahomans know all too well how important local #firefighters are to our communities- even during the #COVID19 crisis.   Today I'm in DC working with my @housesciencegop colleagues- responsibly practicing social distancing guidelines- working to improve the @FEMA grant process. https://t.co/vVVruo5Xi7

Oklahoma's farmers & ranchers have plenty of questions about the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program.  CFAP is a first step but @USDA & Congress must provide additional support for producers. Check out @okfarmbureau's Top 5 takeaways from our webinar ↓ https://t.co/2UZFE85J0e
As Oklahoma reopens our local economies testing must remain a priority!  #COVID19 testing is available to ALL Oklahomans. FIND OUT MORE ↓ https://t.co/SHSPQO2NKz

Reports of @TheJusticeDept's continued investigation into the meatpacking industry is encouraging news for cattle ranchers. The COVID-19 pandemic exposed the vulnerabilities of America's food supply chain & accentuated the challenges beef producers face. https://t.co/HU7Z5fBUon

During the #COVID19 pandemic the decline in live cattle prices and cattle slaughter capacity has severely impacted Oklahoma's cattle producers.  Many of our cattle producers are harmed by @USDA's April 15th date for CFAP. @USDA must improve this shortcoming ASAP.   READ MORE ↓

REMINDER: @USDA's Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP) will go live tomorrow May 26th.   CFAP will provide direct relief to producers who faced price declines and additional marketing costs due to #COVID19. For more information or to apply visit below ↓

.@USDA's Coronavirus Food Assistance Program is a first step but Congress and the Administration must improve this package and deliver much needed additional support to our producers whose losses will far outstrip available assistance under CFAP.  For more info or to apply ↓

As Oklahoma works to safely and responsibly reopen our local economies testing must remain a priority.   Yesterday @HHSGov awarded more than $4.5 million to Oklahoma to expand our testing capacity and provide more resources to help in our fight against #COVID19.
@okstate continues to spur research and innovation as Oklahoma works to expand #COVID19 testing. https://t.co/XfwRWrrYiJ
Proud of @okstate's leadership in the nationwide fight against the #coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/hb3ssa9lUA

During the #COVID19 pandemic the need for rural broadband has never been so apparent. Communities across Oklahoma are becoming increasingly reliant on rural broadband.   Thank you @SecretarySonny for continuing to provide broadband to rural Americans across our country. https://t.co/BWkQKnop2A

Access to affordable reliable high-speed internet is essential in today's society.  #COVID19 has shined a spotlight on the inequities our rural communities face due to lack of broadband. That's why I was proud to co-sponsor the Universal Broadband Act.  https://t.co/TsVsoq23ls

The #coronavirus pandemic has emphasized the importance of broadband access for our rural communities schools and health care providers. Reliable access to high-speed broadband is critical in a world fueled by the increasing demand of connectivity.  https://t.co/CDfRqXPdaR

The U.S. economy while disrupted now is fueled by hardworking Americans who understand the unprecedented challenges posed by #COVID19.   Our economy is resilient and with the relief provided by Congress & the support provided by the @federalreserve we will come back strong.

From computer scientists modeling the impact of the virus to engineers powering our electrical grid- our nation's scientists engineers and researchers are playing a critical role in our fight against #COVID19.   Thank you to all of America's scientists and lab workers! https://t.co/0DXoL7JmuY
